content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-124-02-B
|Item_parent=Menopause, premature ovarian failure, andropause, age-related androgen deficiency (See item 330)
|Item_parent_short=Menopause, premature ovarian failure, andropause, age-related androgen deficiency (See item 330)
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the epidemiological characteristics of the natural menopause
|Description=None
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Florence Trémollieres,Anna Gosset
|Order=2}}

The median age of natural menopause in the European population is between 50 and 51 and a half.

Around 10-15% of women will reach menopause before the age of 45.

question.title: What is the typical age range for natural menopause in the European population?

option_a.title: 45-49 years
option_a.description: A common age range for early menopause

option_b.title: 50-51.5 years
option_b.description: The correct age range for natural menopause in the European population

option_c.title: 55-59 years
option_c.description: A possible age range for early menopause

option_d.title: 60-64 years
option_d.description: A common age range for late menopause
